info.title: Sales Quotation (A2X)
info.description:
In every API call, you can make use of the following operations:

You can read entire sales quotations or only parts of the data, using the provided filters.

You can create sales quotations. Note that you must use “deep insert” requests (a header plus the following entities: header partner, header pricing element, header text, item, item partner, item pricing element, and item text). You cannot create entities without including any related entities.

For existing sales quotations, you can create new items. Note that you must use “deep insert” requests (with the following entities: item partner, item pricing element, and item text). You cannot create entities without including any related entities.

For existing sales quotations, you can update the header, header partner, header pricing element, header text, item, item partner, item pricing element, and item text.

For existing sales quotations, you can delete the header, header partner, header pricing element, header text, item, item partner, item pricing element, and item text.

You can accept or deny approval requests for sales quotations that cannot be processed without the consent of an approver.

Note: Certain elements and entities can only be used if you activate the business function ISR_RETAILSYSTEM. For more information, see Business Documentation.

x-sap-shortText: Create, read, update, and delete sales quotations with this synchronous OData API

get.summary: Reads all sales quotation headers.
get.description: Reads the header data of all sales quotations in the system.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.description: Creates a sales quotation header using deep insert requests. This means consumers can create a sales quotation with all possible sub-entities (for example, header partners or items).

get.summary: Reads the header of a specific sales quotation.
get.description: Reads the header data of a specific sales quotation. Consumers must pass the sales quotation ID (key field).

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.description: Updates the header data of a specific sales quotation. Consumers must pass the sales quotation ID (key field).

delete.description: Deletes the header data of a specific sales quotation. Consumers must pass the sales quotation ID (key field).

get.summary: Reads all items of a specific sales quotation.
get.description: Reads all item data of a specific sales quotation. Consumers must pass the sales quotation ID (key field).

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates a sales quotation item for a specific sales quotation.
post.description: Creates a sales quotation item for a specific sales quotation using deep insert requests. This means consumers can create an item with all possible sub-entities (for example, item partners or item texts).

get.summary: Reads the header partners of a specific sales quotation.
get.description: Reads the business partner data from the header of a specific sales quotation. Consumers must pass the sales quotation ID (key field). The data is relevant for all items for which no item-specific partners are maintained.

post.summary: Creates one or more value-added services for a specific sales quotation item.
post.description: Creates value-added service data for a specific sales quotation item that you must specify in the payload. You can use this operation by activating the business function ISR_RETAILSYSTEM.

parameters.name: SalesQuotationItem
parameters.description: Item number of the reference item

get.summary: Reads a specific line of a value-added service.
get.description: Reads a specific value-added service data using the sales quotation ID, item number, vas service type and vas subservice type. You can use this operation by activating the business function ISR_RETAILSYSTEM.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates a specific value-added service of a sales quotation item.
patch.description: Updates the data of a specific value-added service item using sales quotation ID, item number, vas service type and vas subservice type. You can use this operation by activating the business function ISR_RETAILSYSTEM.

delete.summary: Deletes a specific value-added service of a sales quotation item.
delete.description: Delete the data of a specific value-added service item using the sales quotation ID, item number, vas service type and vas subservice type.  You can use this operation by activating the business function ISR_RETAILSYSTEM.

parameters.name: SalesQuotation
parameters.description: Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes

parameters.name: SalesQuotation
parameters.description: Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes

post.description:
Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=152).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*

multipart/mixed;boundary=request-separat.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET A_SalesQuotation HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

multipart/mixed.example:
--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--
